muenzpraeger:swagger:import.description: Auto-generate Apex classes from Swagger/OpenAPI definition files
examples:
$ sfdx muenzpraeger:swagger:import -d . -p http://petstore.swagger.io/v2/swagger.json
  Apex classes have been generated.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: specify the API version (defaults to API version of your DevHub)

path.name: path
path.description: URL or local file path for Swagger definition file

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: local folder for storing the created files

force.name: force
force.description: A Java installation could not be found.

muenzpraeger:apex:swagger:generate.description: Auto-generate Apex classes from Swagger/OpenAPI definition files
examples:
$ sfdx muenzpraeger:apex:swagger:generate -d . -p http://petstore.swagger.io/v2/swagger.json
  Swagger definition file got created.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

file.name: file
file.description: local file name for Swagger definition file

instance.name: instance
instance.description: local folder for storing the created files
